schema_conversion

Class PerformWork

  • java.lang.Object
    • schema_conversion.PerformWork
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    class PerformWork
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Each Neo4j dump file is split into chunks, which are operated on by individual threads using this class, and in particular its run() method.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PerformWork

        PerformWork(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> strings,
            java.lang.String file)
        Constructor for setting up a worker thread.
        Parameters:
        strings - List of strings for the thread to work on.
        file - Index (letter/char) of file to store results from this thread. File should be a single letter such as a, b, or c.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Runnable methods that parses the Neo4j dump into a JSON representation that is used later on when executing the new relations on the SQL backend.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • calculateDataType

        private java.lang.String calculateDataType(java.lang.String key,
                                           com.google.gson.JsonElement value)
        Calculate the datatype of a key, based on an example value presented to this method. This method mostly works as expected, however fails in some cases where it inteprets a field as an INT, where in fact it should be of type BIGINT. The tool cannot currently handle this automatically, however can be fixed manually in the code.
        Parameters:
        key - Key of the field being tested.
        value - An example value of this field.
        Returns:
        The correct datatype.

      • addToLabelMap

        private void addToLabelMap(java.lang.String nodeLabel,
                           java.lang.String key,
                           java.lang.String type)
        Each label has all of its keys (and their datatypes) stored.
        Parameters:
        nodeLabel - Label of the node.
        key - Key of the property.
        type - The datatype of the property (see calculateDataType()).
